abstract: The deal is the latest by G.E. in the energy sector, as the conglomerate builds out its deepwater oil and natural gas production capabilities.
snippet: The deal is the latest by G.E. in the energy sector, as the conglomerate builds out its deepwater oil and natural gas production capabilities.
lead_paragraph: General Electric said on Sunday that it had agreed to buy the John Wood Group’s well-support business for about $2.8 billion, as it sought to bolster its unconventional oil and natural gas production services.

headline.main: G.E. to Buy John Wood Unit for $2.8 Billion

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Steve Lohr
